text: Analysis of the modulation of transcriptional activity in myelopoiesis and leukemogenesis .
Acute myeloid leukemia ( AML ) is still associated with a mortality of 60 to 80 % .
AML is characterized by a block in myeloid differentiation .

The transcription factors <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C/EBPalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are responsible for normal myeloid differentiation from stem cells to monocytes or granulocytes .

In particular , <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces expression of the <extra_id_0> macrophage colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) receptor and the development of monocytes , whereas <extra_id_0> C/EBPalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> increases the expression of the <extra_id_0> granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF) receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and leads to mature granulocytes .

In AML , chromosomal aberrations result in oncoproteins such as <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / ETO , <extra_id_0> PML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> RARalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or activated Ras , which can deregulate genes important for normal myelopoiesis .

Thus , <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / ETO can bind to the transcription factor <extra_id_0> C/EBPalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , inhibit <extra_id_0> C/EBPalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transcription , and block granulocytic differentiation .

However , <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / ETO can also synergize with the transcription factor <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to enhance the activity of the <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor promoter .

On the other hand , the <extra_id_0> PML <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> RARalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusion protein causes transcriptional repression by recruiting the nuclear corepressor ( N - CoR ) histone deacetylase complex to the DNA , which results in decreased histone acetylation and a repressive chromatin organization .

Here we describe methods to investigate whether and how signaling agonists induce myeloid differentiation and how oncoproteins might cause AML by modulating the activity of transcription factors that are pivotal for normal myeloid development .
